newsitem.title: USA: INSIGHT- Techs eye key pattern as dlr/mark shrinks.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT- Techs eye key pattern as dlr/mark shrinks.

text.p: A bearish turn in dollar/mark on Thursday had chartists eyeing the neckline of a six-week head-and-shoulders pattern, which was pegged variously between 1.6710 and 1.6725.
After opening above 1.6800, dollar/mark had slid to the top of this range by 1400 EST/1900 GMT.

"It's threatening a bear break below a 1.6710/20 neckline of a head-and-shoulders top pattern that started on February 12," said Scott Siller, senior technical analyst at MCM CurrencyWatch. "If we lose 1.6710/20 it should be good for 1.6500, maybe 1.6300."
Technicians said they had expected narrow ranges on Thursday ahead of the long Easter weekend and some were leery about reading too much into dollar/mark's retreat.
Ben Morden, technical analyst at consulting firm I.D.E.A. Inc, said he needed to see more price action to convince him that the topping formation was intact.

"There has been talk that we're developing a head-and-shoulders pattern but I want to stay away from that," he said. "Today's selloff is coming in thin volume in conjunction with bond and stock weakness."
